By advertising that[` American Idol'] isn't going to be as mean, they might be losing their professional credibility,'' says Robert Thompson , a professor of television and pop culture at Syracuse University. It's not as meaningful to get a compliment from someone who's always nice. In past seasons, you'd see people running out of the[ judging] room saying,` Simon Cowell loved me!' Simon Cowell was always the one people cared about, because he was the hardest one to get. Robert Thompson points out that, as a British unknown looking for American fame, Simon Cowell used meanness as a savvy PR move- one that wouldn't work for Jennifer Lopez or Steven Tyler .`` Outside of the music industry

She won't be the only Washingtonian at the dinner. Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer also will be there, as will Christine Gregoire 's daughter, Courtney. An item in The Washington Post notes: The White House will be serving its more than 225 guests a haute meat-and-potatoes meal: Dry-aged rib-eye steak, buttermilk crisp onions, double-stuffed potatoes, and creamed spinach. That's after a first-course of pear salad, and a second course of poached Maine lobster with orange-glazed carrots and black trumpet mushrooms. The post-dinner entertainment will be heavy on jazz, with Dianne Reeves and Herbie Hancock among the musicians slated to perform.
